name: speechmaker
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a person who gives speeches in public, especially someone who is skilled at doing this: The former president, a veteran speechmaker, was used to 50,000-seat stadiums and convention halls. She was an excellent organizer, and an effective writer and speech-maker.
More examplesFewer examplesHe was considered as persuasive a speechmaker as he had been a pastor.The speechmaker showed, in words, that he was also a man of experience, and a man who wanted to give something back to the people who gave it to him.As an inspirational speech-maker, the manager hardly ranks alongside Bill Shankly, let alone Winston Churchill.
